alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Estancia Valley; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 1:29PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL, SOUTHERN SANTA FE AND NORTH CENTRAL TORRANCE COUNTIES THROUGH 200 PM MDT... At 128 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near McIntosh, or 9 miles southeast of Moriarty, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Edgewood, Moriarty, Estancia, McIntosh, Stanley, Cedar Grove and Clines Corners. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 188 and 217. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 250 and 263. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Estancia Valley; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood
